issues.description: get_part_range() returns an invalid range for zeroâ€‘length objects (end becomes -1, producing "bytes 0--1/0"), which could break range handling for empty objects.
upload_part_copy() calls parse_range_header() unconditionally. If CopySourceRange is missing, this raises an exception.
head_object() does not include a ContentRange header when returning partial content, which differs from AWS behaviour.
validate_failed_precondition() compares If-Modified-Since with '<' instead of '<=', potentially missing 304 responses when timestamps match exactly.
